description: This chili recipe is a game changer with tender, fall-apart shredded beef and a unique touch of Mexican Masa Harina. The aroma alone will have your mouth watering and your guests begging for the recipe.
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add diced onion and minced garlic, sauté until translucent.
Add the shredded beef and cook until browned.
Stir in diced tomatoes, kidney beans, chili powder, cumin, and beef broth. Bring to a simmer.
Cover and let simmer for 8 hours, stirring occasionally.
In the last hour, mix Masa Harina with a little water to create a slurry and stir it into the chili to thicken.
Season with salt and pepper to taste before serving.
tips: For the best flavor, allow the chili to sit overnight in the refrigerator and reheat before serving. This allows the flavors to meld beautifully.

structured_content.content: This chili is not just any chili; it's a comforting bowl of warmth that brings everyone together. The tender beef melts in your mouth, while the spices create a rich, aromatic experience that is simply irresistible.

structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Start by dicing the onion and mincing the garlic. Shred the beef if not pre-shredded.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Follow the step-by-step instructions for sautéing and simmering to develop flavors.
Finishing Touches:
Thicken the chili with Masa Harina and adjust seasoning before serving.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Cook low and slow for tender beef and deep flavors.
  • Avoid overcooking the beans to maintain their texture.
  • The chili is ready when the beef easily shreds with a fork.
  • Store leftovers in an airtight container for up to a week.

structured_content.content: Sharing this chili with friends and family has created countless memories. It's a dish that not only fills the stomach but also warms the heart.
Consider adding a splash of Worcestershire sauce or a pinch of smoked paprika for an extra layer of flavor. Fresh cilantro or lime juice can brighten the dish just before serving.
Serve with cornbread, tortilla chips, or over rice for a complete meal. Pair with a cold beer or a refreshing soda for the perfect combination.
For a vegetarian version, substitute the beef with lentils or mushrooms. You can also experiment with different beans or add vegetables like bell peppers for added nutrition.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use a good quality beef for the best flavor.
  • Let the chili rest for a day for even better taste.
  • Stir occasionally to prevent sticking.
  • Garnish with cheese and sour cream for an impressive finish.

structured_content.content: Don't be intimidated by the cooking time; the results are worth it! Enjoy the process and the delicious reward that awaits you.
